snippet: The International Energy Agency also said the United States would be a net exporter by 2030, partly because of advances in unlocking reserves in shale rock.
abstract: International Energy Agency says United States will overtake Saudi Arabia as world's leading oil producer by about 2017; also forecasts US will be net exporter by 2030, partly because of advances in unlocking reserves in shale rock.
lead_paragraph: The International Energy Agency also said the United States would be a net exporter by 2030, partly because of advances in unlocking reserves in shale rock.

headline.seo: Report Sees U.S. as Top Oil Producer, Overtaking Saudi Arabia, in 5 Years
headline.main: U.S. to Be World’s Top Oil Producer in 5 Years, Report Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Forecast to Be No. 1 Oil Producer
